definition:
The *Kronecker delta* $\delta_{ij}$ is defined as having value 1 when
$i=j$ and 0 otherwise ($i$ and $j$ are integers). It may also be written
as $\delta^{ij}$ or $\delta^i_j$. It is a special case of the
generalized Kronecker delta symbol.

The delta symbol was first used in print by Kronecker in 1868[@Higham].

[**Example.**]{}

The $n \times n$ identity matrix $I$ can be written in terms of the
Kronecker delta as simply the matrix of the delta, $I_{ij}=\delta_{ij}$,
or simply $I=(\delta_{ij})$.

[3]{} N. Higham, Handbook of writing for the mathematical sciences,
Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics, 1998.
